Reviews.Title: “Could be renovated !”
Reviews.Author: tiago_ken
Reviews.Content: Location is great but building/rooms are old. When we left the (old) elevator, we thought we were in a youth hostel (old and dirty 70's carpet + walls without pictures). Rooms are large (Suite). Staff is ok, not more. Positive is that it was not to expensive => You get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: Beyond_all_Borders
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights on business/leisure for about $75 per night. The location is great for sightseeing and shopping. There are many great and inexpensive retaurants only within one and two blocks. The parking was a decent price per night. They had us in the back building "courtyard" which was fine. Supposedly the main building can get a lot of noise from the street at night. The room was average, but the bedding, pillows and matress were very comfortable and higher end. There was a bit of noise from the doors in the main entrance and hallways of our area, but I bring earplugs everywhere now, so I slept well. If you can find this for a good price take it and enjoy the convience of this location!

Reviews.Title: “Not bad for the category/type of hotel it is”
Reviews.Author: GlendaleCA
Reviews.Content: I'm not used to staying @ Best Western, however for the category hotel it is, it seems like a decent place. In a city with high hotel costs, this place was a bargain considering the location and relative amount of updates and general cleanliness. If you book this place well in advance you get a very good rate. As much as I would liked to have stayed at the Westin, this place was 172$ cheaper per nite. That is a lot to me! The outside of the building is quite dingy and looks like a prison. However the very very tiny lobby is clean, not fancy but serviceable. The staff working at the check-in counter are quite friendly and helpful. The halls in the hotel are pretty dark leading to the rooms but they are clean. The rooms are clean and simple. There's nothing fancy or upgraded in here, with the exception of a flat screen in the bedroom area. The bathroom is the only part of the room needing serious renovation. It feels old and tired, particularly the countertops. The windows in the room are probably the worst quality of any chain hotel I've ever experienced. The noise level from outside is truly insane. I wish I could give this place 3.5. It's not quite 4 b/c of the bathroom, halls, windows. However it is not a scary place to stay. At the same time, it's not like you're gonna jump up and down with excitement to come back to your comfortable hotel room and want to spread out and relax. So if you're looking for a place to relax on vacation and sleep in late, this may not be the place (however, w/ the hotel prices in YVR, this place may be one of your better choices). I'd say this is a solid step below a Hampton Inn, which may be what the typical Best Western is supposed to be like. If so, it generally meets the standard for what I would expect. The area around is eclectic. Don't be scared away by the multiple sex shops across the street and down the street and across the street (hahaha). The neighborhood is a fun, hipstery kind of area with lots of good pubs. Around the corner on Davie street you have lots of great restaurants and you're in a few minute walk of the Yaletown area. so it's got plenty to offer. Lastly, the pull-out sofa couch was one of the more comfortable of these types of slept on in a long time. While the sheets and comforter were not what I'm used to, they probably are typical of BW. All in all, I'd stay again if the prices at other places were sky high.

Reviews.Title: “Unremarkable/Satisfactory”
Reviews.Author: NEWYORKPROF
Reviews.Content: It's OK. The first room we were shown had to be changed as it reeked of smoke (on a on-smoking floor), and the second room we ended up in was quite small. Desk help was OK, didn't always provide what was asked for until asked for twice--as if stalling on doing the work (i.e. requesting a safe deposit box, or asking for a receipt of my stay there regardless of having purchased the room on hotels.com). Food in restaurant was good.

Reviews.Title: “Clean but very inconvenient and old”
Reviews.Author: j l
Reviews.Content: Location was good, however, the room we got placed in was behind the main building which was fine; except for the fact that we had to cross through a scary alley-way to get to it. One night the key cards didn't work and it was dark...not a good feeling. Plus there was an awful stench in the alley that made me want to vomit. Inside the room was clean, but very poorly lit (one of the lamps was even missing the light bulb). Once we got a lightbulb put in the lamp we found that in order to use the coffee maker; you had to unplug the lamp...and vice verse...very inconvenient. Another night, there were ridiculous stomping noises going on above the room all night long which made it hard to sleep...besides the annoying light that came through the cracks around the door. Oh, and the heater? Yeah, it was a piece of old junk. The temperature did not regulate properly so all through the night it was either super stuffy or freezing cold (partly due to the heater deciding to blow out cold air after a while instead of warm air)...totally frustrating. The staff was friendly for the most part, but not very informative as far as concierge-type things went. We were pretty much left to figure things out on our own.

Reviews.Title: “Gets better and better”
Reviews.Author: sebsreichel
Reviews.Content: Hard to believe but every time I come here the is some surprise that makes my stay better. This time it was the option to tell the maid the times and type of service i wanted when she came in, and if i wanted my room cleaned at all. Cool. I like the location and the view you can get of Granville. I have also stayed at the courtyard side and they were very claustrophobic so i dont recomend them unless you are in a very tight budget since it is at an entirely different building Of this hotel I never understood their last renovation that made the property still look old even though it was renewed. I do like how clean everything is and to see so many signs to make my experience better. My biggest regret is that you cannot open a window, not even a crack unless you sign a liability form. Ridiculous. Not even in NYC. You should be able to vent a little.

Reviews.Title: “What a gem!”
Reviews.Author: bubbelbine
Reviews.Content: I usually write reviews when I am unhappy about services but today I have to write you because I had such a wonderful experience at my event yesterday! I had quite a large group at my all-day event and from planning to execution this was easy sailing. In the planning process Dee’s suggestions helped me find the right room and catering set-up and it actually saved me money. Love the meeting planner package! Thank you for your support and your fast responses. On the day of the event I was extremely early because I wanted to make sure the room is set up and the AV equipment is there and connected. I could have slept in longer because everything was exactly the way I wanted it to be set-up and there was no need for me to make any changes. What a relaxed start to our full day. Karen is wonderful, she welcomed me when I arrived and went through the whole set-up with me and made sure I knew my way around lights and AV to comfortably handle those during the day. She made sure we always had fresh water and coffee and was very approachable when I had a question. She is just a pleasure to work with. Lunch was wonderful and I saw great team work where everyone pitched in to make sure my big group had lunch set-up on time. Loved, loved the food! I had seconds and was tempted to ask for a doggie bag. Part of the team was Ann who volunteered to show me around the meeting facilities after I told her this was my first time at the Best Western Chateau Granville. I can’t believe I never came here before for my events! Meeting rooms for events of all sizes in one space. Add the amazing parking rates and you guys are unbeatable. Thank you, Ann! I will be back for sure and let me meeting planner colleagues know about this gem!

Reviews.Title: “Great deal at the courtyard”
Reviews.Author: Jaime L
Reviews.Content: I went to Vancouver with my wife in March and we stayed at the courtyard. We got a great price and we chose the courtyard after reading some reviews. Excellent location (downtown), great attention from all the staff, warm welcome and good breakfast. Clean, comfortable and nice.We recommend it and have a nice time in Vancouver!

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME DEAL”
Reviews.Author: mags1340
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located on Grandville in the heart of downtownVancouver . Its location couldn't be better for what i paid for the room. I originally booked a courtyard room (means.... i have to walk up 3 flights of stairs, and room didn't have a microwave or a frdige) but i saved $35! Once i arrived they immediatly upgraded my to a standard room for no extra charge. Rooms are very clean plus they have a balcony. Excellent for dest staff. I"d definetely stay there again.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Cradle Mountain-Lake St. Clair National Park, Australia
Reviews.Title: “Ask for a courtyard room”
Reviews.Author: Ches81
Reviews.Content: although a little tired BW Van was ok, the parking was free and we had 24hr use so left our car there after we check out and the room was clean and tidy, we had a courtyard room with 2 queen beds and ensuite, a short walk to granville island for the market and brewery or short walk into the city for shopping and restaurants. cheap clean close, couldn't want more

Reviews.Title: “Good Stay”
Reviews.Author: DiverRob
Reviews.Content: Have stayed here often in the "tower", but this time I stayed in the annex called the "Courtyard", 30 seconds walk across the back alley. It was clean, the room large, everything worked including WiFi and the price was great! And I found it to be very quiet, sometimes in the tower Granville street can be noisy at night. Perfectly adequate for a stay, service excellent in a perfect place to explore from. Buy a transit pass for $9 a day and go exploring on skytrain, bus and seabus! Numerous bars, restaurants within walking distance and the Bar/ restaurant there is good too.

Reviews.Title: “Staff warm and helpful.”
Reviews.Author: Natalie&Chantal
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed for two weeks while my mom was in St. Paul's hospital. Staff were very friendly, helpful and accommodating to our needs. Rooms were spacious, comfortable and clean. Excellent location in the downtown core. Easy walk to shopping, restaurants, clubs. Convenient underground parking. Free wifi, computers and printer. Restaurant on site. Rooms include mini-fridge, microwave, coffee maker, tv, cable, phone.

Reviews.Title: “My home away from home”
Reviews.Author: snowbunny58
Reviews.Content: I was born and raised in Vancouver and lived there for about 38 years. I finally moved up north about 15 years ago.I travel back down 3 or 4 times a year to shop or go to concerts ect... When we go we always stay at the Chateau Granville. I really like that we always get a suite, not just a room. Makes it easier to watch TV ect... without waking my husband. Its always clean and as they get to know you, they treat you like returning family. The food is actually quite good in the hotel as well. Make sure you ask for a free gym pass, if you,re so inclined. Its about a block away, and is state of the art. The best thing is the location. Smack, dab in the middle of downtown and walking distance to theaters, shopping, the dome for football or hockey games. The casino is within walking distance as well. Walk along Granville street and get on the skytrain to metrotown shopping center, or hang a left down robson for more upscale shopping. The people watching from your balcony or out on the street is very diverse.Granville street used to be a rough area and still has a few little glitches, but has basicly been revamped into the hot place for clubbing , shopping ect... Although you still see the odd homeless soul or drug deal going down, its actually very safe for a stroll. The cost for a suite is actually very reasonable and all in all a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Does the job! We'll be back.”
Reviews.Author: 206TravelGuy
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here a handful over times over the last few years, and it's the same every time (which isn't a bad thing). Sometimes it's nice knowing what to expect. The rooms with balconies, overlooking Granville street are very nice, but they are a bit more expensive than the courtyard rooms. During this last trip we stayed in the courtyard and saved about $40. The courtyard rooms are quiet, and convenient. They seem a bit older than the rooms in the tower, but still decent. Parking is about $15 a day, and the parking garage can fill up quickly on a weekend, so get there early and grab a spot!

Reviews.Title: “OK”
Reviews.Author: air00k
Reviews.Content: The room was a bit old , the toilet older, but overall a good hotel. I stayed in the courtyard rooms, which are behind the hotel, but in a very quiet place.

Reviews.Title: “great downtown view!”
Reviews.Author: DGA69
Reviews.Content: i stay here quite a bit and the main thing that brings me back is the one bedroom suite with the balcony that overlooks granville street! there's so much room in here it doesn't feel like a hotel! & there's a microwave & fridge so it helps make it feel that more comfortable!

Reviews.Title: “On reflection a quieter location would have been a wiser choice.”
Reviews.Author: Martin H
Reviews.Content: Staff were friendly and helpful, especially when we received a parking ticket in the hotel car park. This was sorted out. We were in the courtyard annex and our room was adjacent to the main road and because of the junction this proved to be very noisy. We should have moved after the first night but didn't,so we had some disturbed nights. However the hotel was well situated and within close proximity to all the sites, especially if you want to walk everywhere. We would probably not stay here again, somewhere in a quieter location would suit us better, a short journey into town would be preferable to a disturbed nights sleep. Nothing to do with the hotel, but it was a surprise to find so many street beggars in Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and very friendly staff!”
Reviews.Author: PaulArts
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful! We had a room in the Courtyard part. The rooms are fine (no window though) but the entrance to this separate building is a bit dodgy. You have to cross a very quite alley which does not feel extremely safe. If you don't mind then that's fine, otherwise request a room in the main tower. The location of the hotel is excellent, right on Granville street very near the main shopping and nightlife district. Note to the hotel manager: you might want to think about cleaning the outside of the hotel, it doesn't do justice to your hotel the way it looks now..

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: airborne2201
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located on the western side of downtown Vancouver and offers great views in the tower in any direction. Right on Granville St. this is ideal for seeing the sights of downtown during the day then hitting all the bars/clubs right down the street at night. The price is good and they have a good staff that is helpful with any problems. Parking is right underneath the hotel so it makes it easy to access. Each time I go to Vancouver I stay here and they even have a small courtyard area that is great for just walking in and out of your room not connected to the tower so no waiting for elevators.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and comfortable room”
Reviews.Author: 3548Meg
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were returning from a cruise and spent an extra day in Vancouver. The hotel was conveniently located for our short visit. The staff was very friendly and helpful in suggestions for things to see in one day and places to eat. We were able to hop on a city tour bus in front of the hotel and later walk down Granville St. to enjoy the sights. The room appeared to be newly renovated and the bed was the most comfortable of our vacation! The price was a little high but we discovered this was because Saturday is when the cruise ships come in!

Reviews.Title: “Only saving grace was friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: gowestyoungwoman
Reviews.Content: Noisy into the wee hours of the morning; strong chemical and cigarette smoke smells that didn't subside even after 3 days stay; loud hotel patrons shouting and banging on walls in hallway at night; had to pay a 200. cc authorization and sign a liability waver to open windows in room

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Firenze08
Reviews.Content: We were first giving a smaller room then what we booked. But the staff corrected the mistake very fast. The room was quiet and clean. The view and the balcony were great. There was a Big bus stop just at the door of the hotel. Restaurants are just a short walk from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Have stayed in better for less money”
Reviews.Author: kv_wood
Reviews.Content: We arrived here after a week camping in the Rockies. The hotel was easy to find and had underground parking ($14 per night). The front desk staff were very helpful and we were escorted to our courtyard room which is in a small complex over the street from the hotel. Other reviewers have not been keen on this area but it was nice - as long as you know when you book it that it is separate from the main hotel. The Queen room that we booked was a little bit dated but very large with two queen beds. The shower whilst working was not excellent. The air conditioning was effective but far too noisy to leave on overnight. The hotel is well located close to shopping and restaurant districts. Overall there is nothing really wrong with this hotel but we paid $170 and I have had much better hotels for the same or less money.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible service by the staff”
Reviews.Author: jim7x57
Reviews.Content: who could not have been more helpful. Good location at a Big Red Bus stop. Clean rooms. A good hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Location & Space”
Reviews.Author: Victoria19
Reviews.Content: This is a great location in Vancouver even though there are some questionable adult shops close by. The king size rooms are like small suite size with sep. large bedroom which is great for travel and privacy. I do question the quality of the seating in the livingroom however. The sofas and chairs are filled with concrete like foam - not comfortable at all. The beds are wonderfully comfortable though and if you are there for medical reasons St. Paul's hospital is within a short walking distance. There is a fridge and microwave in the room which is very convenient. Private safe parking available for addidional charge. The location is ideal as it is close to anything and everything wonderful in Vancouver BC.

Reviews.Title: “A Little Bit of Quiet in the City Center”
Reviews.Author: FreddieMG
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the garden suites that are located behind the main tower, across the alley (an alley that is well lit and clean, I should add). You go through a secure metal door that opens with your room card, into a very nice private garden with nice trees, plants and a gazebo. There are 3 sections of rooms, with about 10 rooms per section. The room we were in was the basic queen bed room, which was an average size, looked to have been renovated recently (very tastefully) and very clean. The best part of this room was how quiet it was. There are no long hallways with people wandering up and down them; we only had one direct neighbouring room on this floor. I could hear absolutely no noise from the busy streets of downtown Vancouver outside. Add to all this a wonderfully comforable memory foam (I think) bed and I had some of the best sleeps I have had in a long time - and I'm a light sleeper. This hotel also offers free passes to the Steve Nash Fitness Center a couple of blocks away - excellent facility! The ONLY cons to this place - there was no view (wall of building right next door - but this is probably why you couldn't hear street noise), there is no fridge and the cable TV is basic only - minimal channels. None of these was any hardship to us - I would gladly stay in the Garden Suites of the Chateau Granville again - quiet, secure, comfortable!!!

Reviews.Title: “The Real Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: anacreon100
Reviews.Content: We had a three day stay in Vancouver and selected this hotel based on the reviews at this site. We had what was arguably the best room in the hotel - top floor, closest to the street which gave us a panoramic view of Granville and the downtown. Our room was also furthest from the elevator, which some people may not like for but for us it meant it was quiet, and that was perfect. The room was well appointed, perfectly clean, comfortable, and for out purposes pretty much perfect. The room access an outside balcony, which you have to pay a deposit to use and as long as you don't do something stupid like throw things off the balcony, then that is refunded at the end of your stay. If you want the sanitized Vancouver, stay further uptown. Not to say there is anything wrong with this location. On the contrary, located midway between Granville Island and downtown, you can walk to either area in about 20 minutes or so. We left our car parked the whole time. Granted, we like walking so did a lot of it. There is a real mix of businesses in this area, and so a real mix of people. (Across the road is a trendy clothing retailer you find in most major malls, sandwiched between two "adult" stores!) The beds, the linens, the furnishings - all great. Friendly front desk service. Rooms made up promptly. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: RickyCafe
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located close to downtown Vancouver. The accomodation part of the hotel is older and is of a moderate 'high rise' contruction. Our rooms was on the 12th floor, there were three or four above us. \the bedroms are comfortable, ours comprising a sitting room aea with a door to the bedroom. The Bathroom is off the sitting room area. The accomodation was very comfortable but the sound insulation could be better in terms of eliminating traffic noise. Everything was spotlessly clean. The restaurant was not used by us, but I can comment that this is quite modern and stylish. The bar looked very well stocked.

Reviews.Title: “Great location great Value”
Reviews.Author: Jetz48
Reviews.Content: Very clean well appointed rooms in a fantastic location for walkers. The Canada Line station is just steps away, and providesw easy access to and from YVC

Reviews.Title: “We would definitely stay here again”
Reviews.Author: cf_travellers
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights. We had great friendly service at the front desk when we arrived. We were given a courtyard room. The walk to the courtyard was a bit sketchy. You walk through a door at the back of the tower and you walk across the alleyway to the courtyard building. The courtyard building is very safe. It is surrounded by a locked gate. You get through the locked gate with your room key. Then to get into the building there is another locked door. Our room was very clean and comfy. The courtyard room walls were a bit thin, I could hear some people in the next room sometimes. We could barely hear any street noise at all. I was quite surprised how quiet our room was because Granville Street is quite loud at night with all the bars, etc. Parking was about $14.00 per night. I would definitely stay here again. There is tons of shopping and restaurants along Granville Street.

Reviews.Title: “Well located”
Reviews.Author: structed
Reviews.Content: Hotel is clean and located in the heart of the Granville entertainment area. Staff was attentive. We had a suite and found it to be roomy and comfortable. Hotel needs to clarify its amenities as some things that are implied as being available just are not, such as guest laundry and free breakfast. Other than that i would recommend the hotel. Fridge and microwave would be nice additions to the room.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel but Inconsiderate Guests”
Reviews.Author: AJTS
Reviews.Content: The hotel and staff were great. We stayed in the "Courtyard" part which was very quaint even though access is through the alley. I don't know if all the rooms in there are adjoining, but there is no sound proofing between the rooms - the next door neighbors were up until 1 am. We were at the room right next to the entry/exit and were constantly woken up by guests entering and exiting very noisily. No consideration was taken to quietly shut the main door. So do not get a room next to the entry/exit door. We did stay in the main building a few years ago and were pleased with the results. Just keep in mind the incredible noise from other guests that are generated in the Courtyard area and make sure that you are a heavy sleeper before booking a room in there. Otherwise, the staff and the restaurant was very agreeable.

Reviews.Title: “Upgraded room and great view”
Reviews.Author: walkswithafriend
Reviews.Content: I usually stay at this hotel when in Vancouver because it is just a block from the office. The hotel is clean and when I arrived this time they gave me a room on the 14th floor. I think it pays to be a member of Best Western and it is a free membership. When I walked in the room I could not believe how big it was. Big bar area, Boardroom Table and big bed. The bathroom was not huge but clean throughout. The room also had a balcony and windows all the way across the front wall. The heat was fine, didn't have to adjust it. I did not have time to check out the gym or swimming pool. Internet. Very comfortable bed. My friend who is a travel agent came to visit me and was impressed with the room. The area of Granville has some "interesting" ! shops around and clubs - again, had no intention of using them. Lots of places to eat on Davie, a block away. Good for transportation. About 6 blocks from the skytrain to the airport. Small check in area. Front desk man was a little unfriendly. I pointed out to him that my company was paying and he could not find the record and I had to pay. Then I walked a block, got my company to make a reminder phone call and went back to get my money! Annoying! However, the management handled it well. Food in this restaurant is very, very good. Little bit of a walk to Robson and a taxi ride or good walk to the waterfront.

Reviews.Title: “The WORST HOTEL !!”
Reviews.Author: AirforceRN
Reviews.Content: The parking garage was scary felt like in the cave, if you look up the ceiling was very scary. If they assigned your room in the courtyard , be sure not to have any luggages because they do not have any elevator but stairs.This hotel is very outdated.

Reviews.Title: “Service could be better”
Reviews.Author: Zoombah
Reviews.Content: Our room was warm. I called the front desk several times and all they would do is send someone up to check the AC, but never to correct the problem. After I called for the third time, the manager came up to check and offered us another room, but it was no improvement and wasn't worth the move. Luckily it cooled off enough at night for us to sleep. If you book with AAA, be sure and have your agent lock in the free breakfast - otherwise, they won't honor it when you check in.

Reviews.Title: “Great Area. Decent Price”
Reviews.Author: Cutecaroline
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel way back in 1979 with my parents and thought it was awesome so I decided to stay again when my husband and I went on our summer holidays. I'm originally from Vancouver and knew the area would be lively at night so we asked for the highest floor possible. We could still hear noise from the street with the windows open but we expected that so we were prepared with ear plugs. We had an awesome view from our balcony. The room had everything we needed. I wasn't fond of the breakfast we ordered through room service but I'm a chef and a bit of a picky eater. It was really fun to be able to walk to so many places and take the bus. The parking lot was a bit hard to find so, once we found it, we just parked our van and left it there. It was totally safe in there and I found the cost of parking reasonable. It's not an overly cheap hotel but compared to other hotels in the area, it's reasonable. I wouldn't want to stay in a cheaper hotel in a sketchy part of the city. Like I say, I'm a native Vancouverite so I know which parts to avoid.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for the price”
Reviews.Author: Orlblfan
Reviews.Content: After reading some reviews, I was a bit dubious about staying here. We found a great price and decided to give it a try. It turned out to be a nice surprise. We stayed in the Courtyard building. True, the alleyway between the lobby and the courtyard is a little sketchy but the courtyard itself is secured with a lock that is opened with your room key. The courtyard is quite lovely, with a gazebo and nice flowers. The rooms were quite large and very clean. You can tell that the building itself is a little older but the rooms have been updated and are very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, excellent amenities”
Reviews.Author: Skippy510109
Reviews.Content: Always clean and friendly, yes in a transitional part of town; I always feel safe here. Love the beds - way comfy. Love the ameneties like fridge, microwave and good coffee machine. Shower heads have been great all 4 times I have stayed.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good prices.”
Reviews.Author: JulD
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for 5 nights. The room was big, quiet, and comfortable. Most of the staff were very nice and helpful, especially concerning places to see. We had a car for a few days during the trip and the parking was easy to access. However, make sure they charge you the right amount for the parking. We were charged too much, however it was easy to explain and the mistake was corrected by the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: ElleDeeCee
Reviews.Content: As an organizer of a team of people attending an event at this hotel, I recieved a great deal of assistance from Brent O'Connor. He was incredibly helpful and accommodating. Once I arrived, the front desk staff were all very friendly and dealt with requests quickly and efficiently. The room was comfortable, room service was good. The noise from the street could be a bit loud at times, but that's something out of the control of the people at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Greatest for group trip”
Reviews.Author: coastlmst
Reviews.Content: Our stay was wanderful, accomodating the amount of members in our group was so appreciated. Service was great and staff extremely helpful. the only item that we would have liked was to have group closer, Difficult having members in the tower part of the facility. During our stay, it was dark for your youth to cross over the alley way to their rooms. As a director I was not able to check on the members staying in that area as I needed an access key to get in,This was the only concern from the members, being new to the area, crossing the alley way at night, especially our elders. other than that, we loved our stay!

Reviews.Title: “GREAT HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: muscletongue3000
Reviews.Content: of the many times i've been to vancouver, i've passed this property many times. was resently reocmmended to me. located about four blocks from the canada line yale/roundhouse station in the process of remodelling -- great job! one room suite with lots of windows and balcony staff very, very helpful and welcoming small frid, coffee maker and microwave the edge restaurant in building excellent value and quality of food -- sarah my waitress was a delight! I WILL VISIT AGAIN!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location for Party Time”
Reviews.Author: aspen5
Reviews.Content: This was a great place to stay - good central location within walking distance for everything. The service was superb; I read other reviews where staff was apparently rude or disinterested; I can say we had the complete opposite experience. Everyone from the front desk to the restaurant was very friendly and helpful. The restaurant has good food and is very reasonably priced. Room was clean, and comfortable. IF you are a light sleeper get a room with a courtyard view - not street view. Granville is the party street of Vancouver and people were out being loud and partying well into the wee hours of the morning. We were on the 12th floor and could hear the street noise; but - not being a light sleeper did not have issues. I read some reviews criticizing parking - parking was just fine - secure, no direct access from the street. All-in-all a pleasant hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value! Great location! A+ to Chateau Granville!”
Reviews.Author: hollysovdi
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently stayed for four nights at the Chateau Granville. It was our second time staying at the hotel. This stay was the same as our previous stay... well worth it! The hotel is located on Granville Street which has recently been transformed into a great shopping, dining and entertainment area. So in a matter of steps from the lobby of the hotel, you will find yourself in the heart of the downtown. Our room was very large, comfortable and clean. The hotel were friendly and helpful. The only thing to consider for light sleepers is that because it is located on Granville Street, it can be a bit noisy into the night along the north facing rooms. This wasn't an issue for my wife and I but for some it may be.

Reviews.Title: “Wondeful stay, excellent service, convenient location, very clean rooms, and value for money!”
Reviews.Author: Signtseer
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Best Western Chateau Granville in a large party of adults and teenagers, for the purpose of showing our out-of-province visitors the sights of Vancouver. The hotel accommodated our every wish, and the convenient location enabled us to access venues like the Vancouver Aquarium, Science World, Chinatown, and Gas Town with ease. The rooms were spotless, and underground gated parking was a bonus. This is a great hotel with unbeatable value for money!

Reviews.Title: “Great spot for Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: dpedlar
Reviews.Content: The room was a very pleasant surprise, being in downtown Vancouver. The place was clean, roomy and very comfortable and right in the core of the city plus the price the great!

Reviews.Title: “don't do it!”
Reviews.Author: swvictoria
Reviews.Content: ugh, the place is horrible. It is down on Granville surrounded by tatoo parlours and sex shops. The 'courtyard' is across a dingy alley. Hotel is old and the floors squeek. We were on the third floor and were up all night because of the squeeky floor upstairs. Keep this one for the partiers that do not require sleep, it's NO GOOD for familes for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Didn't Feel Safe, Staff Didn't honor free breakfast”
Reviews.Author: elcaringo
Reviews.Content: This is in a bad area of Vancouver. Between the front desk and the rooms is a public dark alley that is very unsafe. The rooms are small, amenities non existant, and dated. The staff would not honor a free breakfast that came with my AAA reservation. Parking is $19/day CDN in a nasty underground garage. The only good thing we can say is it's cheap.

Reviews.Title: “It even looks dirty.”
Reviews.Author: Travelthru1977
Reviews.Content: Was billed on my credit card before even checking out. Probably due to the locale. The parking is underground but not secure you can tell by the numerous signs warning of theft. Stayed in the courtyard.. You are literally in the alley. When you first open the gate it isn't too bad but the rooms are horrible. The room is on an angle, you have to deal with a slope which is a testament to it's quality. It is very noisy, paper thin walls. Prey you avoid a room beside the 90 year old ice machine. The hotel exterior looks like a victim of the industrial revolution, as though it had coal coughed on it. This Eco friendly hotel has plastic cups.. Wrapped in plastic and hid the recycling bin in the closet. Maybe the biggest waste of hotel dollars. Spend 10 more and stay somewhere worthwhile. The guy who showed us where the room was and the parking was the lone bright spot.

Reviews.Title: “We booked this hotel online without...”
Reviews.Author: Beanja9
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel online without seeing it. Upon arrival, you immediately get the impression this place is dodgy. The concrete building is so dirty, the hotel looks like it has been burnt. I have never stayed at a Hotel where you had to pay upfront, PLUS a damage deposit. They also tell you to allow an extra 10 minutes when checkin put so they can go inspect your room for damage. We were put in a room across the alley (yes, in an alley!) with frosted windows and paper thin walls, behind the loud ice machine. The room was clean enough but with only 2 thin pillows and a shower that had a clogged drain, barely spat put water and went cold after 2 minutes. We had to laugh about it, but I couldn't wait to leave!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, grab an end suite or suite in the courtyard.”
Reviews.Author: YK-Northernlights
Reviews.Content: This is now my preferred hotel to stay when in DT Vancouver, mainly due to the value. I have not tried any of the facilities however. They have gated underground parking, great location & view from your own personal balcony & good value for the price. They also have courtyard suites in the cback with carded access, its handy as you do not have to go thru the lobby to get to your room/suite & the courtyard has a pleasent atmosphere. Both the tower & courtyard however have lower grade furnishings.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value and Nice Room”
Reviews.Author: Albuquerque_NMGeezer
Reviews.Content: The hotel is nicely located in the center of everything. Granville Street can seem a little frightening during the evening revelries but is not dangerous (at least compared to Albuquerque, Houston or LA). It gets loud but since we were upgraded from the annex to a room on the 15th floor the noise was far below us even with the balcony door open. My only complaint was an old plumbing system which had the shower oscillating, scald, ice, scald, ice, etc.

Reviews.Title: “OK Courtyard room, location a bit so-so”
Reviews.Author: DutchTravelagent
Reviews.Content: we staye in a courtyard room which is through the lobby, cross an alley and in a 3 storey building with no elevator. Frontdesk put us on a ground floor room so we did not have to drag our suitcases up to the 2nd floor. There was a friendly staff member who took our bags and put them in our room, explaining how everything worked. Very good. I wanted to print out a pdf document but for that you had to pay for pc use plus printing costs. Location: while walking through Granville street, shops and audience became "less": drifters, sex shops, and all sorts of crazy people. Yaletown, on the other hand, closeby, seems to be the new trendy part of Vancouver: lots opf restaurants and friendly people in shops nd streets. All in all, the hotel experience was OK. Make the right choices based upon your own wishes and make sure you are OK with the location. Robson Street is 2 or 3 blocks away on foot.

Reviews.Title: “large rooms but bad AC”
Reviews.Author: kmusicand05
Reviews.Content: The rooms were large but only had AC in the "living room" not the bedrooms, which led to some hot and sleepless nights. Although the website says they have a gym, it is only a "free pass" to a gym 3 blocks away. It also says they have laundry facilities, which is just directions to a coin laundromat several blocks away as well. But the rooms were large and had balconies with good views of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to stay in Downtown Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: permic7
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Best Western Chateau Granville while in Vancouver for a week and we all really enjoyed our stay. The building from the outside is not one bit pleasing but the inside is renovated and is very clean and nice. They staff was always very helpful and kind. The hotel is on Granville St, which is a very busy street and at night can get very very noisy! I would definitely recommend requesting to stay on a higher level. Overall we were pleased with our stay and would stay again if I were to come back to Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but DIFFERANT”
Reviews.Author: michelle-9000
Reviews.Content: The hotel and restaurant were both very nice with a helpful & friendly front desk. The location is what made it differant.You had the old mixer with the new.( stores,restaurants,ect.) There were some really good older places to eat around the hotel. The bellhop that woks the swing shift is amazing with his knowledge of the city and is very helpful.You could tell he loves his job. Would i go back ? YES,i loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: TamVerdun
Reviews.Content: Hotel is very clean, and staff helpful. We stayed in the main hotel - there is another separated three story building as well. The in-house restaurant ’The Edge’ had excellent food, not unreasonable priced for the quality. We’ve stayed at several Best Western’s on our trip out West and found this one to really worth the rate as we got a one bedroom suite that most hotel’s in the area were charging for a guestroom.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: jocatosu
Reviews.Content: The hotel and restaurant were excellent. Good service at the Front Desk, knowledgeable concierge who went out of their way to find my husband his favourite BC wine that we can not get back home. The hotel is located right on Granville Street so it’s in a very walkable location for shopping. Loved everything about this hotel, especially the staff!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic place! Highly recommend! A+”
Reviews.Author: hollysovdi
Reviews.Content: This was our first time at to this hotel……and Wow! We had read the reviews regarding the hotel and it seems from talking to the staff the hotel and area has gone through a major transformation due to the Olympics…..wish we could have been there for that! What a beautiful place. Our room were very clean and felt very homelike and morning breakfast was served extremely fast. The staff were nice and helpful on suggestions of where to eat and about tours to Victoria.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly adequate hotel in a good, central location”
Reviews.Author: KaiserChiefs
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights in June. The hotel looks rather grotty from the outside but is much nicer inside. We stayed in the main building and our room had a bedroom and living area with sleeper sofa. The rooms were clean and perfectly adequate, if a little dated. The hotel is located in an ideal location, easily walkable to downtown and on the main street with the bars. Due to the Vancouver nightlife, this can lead to noise until well into the early hours but this is the price you pay for a central location. Overall, a good hotel but rooms could do with modernising.

Reviews.Title: “central location and charming courtyard suites”
Reviews.Author: kimbers44
Reviews.Content: true, if you stay in the courtyard you have to walk across the alley from the main building, but once you're inside the gate it's charming and 'old world-ish'. friendly, efficient service. comfortable beds, large room, great view of the courtyard and uber-central to everything downtown, my daughter and i will stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value and well located”
Reviews.Author: marxina
Reviews.Content: For its price, this is a comfortable, clean well-located hotel within an easy walk of the Art Gallery, and all Downtown activities and shopping. The secure underground parking is a great asset. Our room was clean and large and staff were efficient. But this is not an up market hotel and does not pretend to be. Be aware that this part of Granville St is quite run down, although not in a disturbing way. Good easy walk to Denman St with its fine restaurants. Excellent value

Reviews.Title: “Odd place but good location.”
Reviews.Author: allthatcat
Reviews.Content: This place looks awful from the outside and I can't really rate the inside as we were put in a separate building after checking in. They called it the 'Court Yard' but I would call it 'Down and Outs Hang-Out'. The actual room was small but ok. To get to it you had to walk down an unlit road to a heavy metal door where you swiped your room card and walked through to the 'Court Yard'. You then walked past what looked like a small apartment block where a security guard actually lived (there were plants etc on the window sill) and we saw the security guard when he let the door slam in our faces. Our small building was horrible, dirty carpet led up to our room, passing other rooms and we had to carry our suitcases up 2 or 3 flights of stairs. To be honest we didn't feel safe at all and the final straw was when we were stared at by 2 girls sitting outside our building door smoking weed - very welcoming! I wouldn't recommend this place for more than one night and parking is expensive. Definitely not for kids.

Reviews.Title: “Fine but nothing special. . .”
Reviews.Author: Darnoc
Reviews.Content: A great location on Granville St is the best feature of this tired-ish BW property. Despite being a loyal guest, my plea for late check out was firmly declined. The room was spacious, clean and well-equipped but a little dated. While we requested a quiet room, the ice maker was our friend all night long. The "free" WiFi demonstrated all the bandwidth of dial-up.

Reviews.Title: “Extended Stay- wish we could have stayed longer!”
Reviews.Author: fatherspodokomodo
Reviews.Content: I and a few friends have student visas to work in Vancouver for one year so our plan was to stay in a hostel for a while before getting our bearings and finding an appartment/house. However, after a couple of nights there, we found that the Chateau Granville was actually cheaper when all 4 of us shared a room! We had the security of having our own keys, own bathroom, free internet and clean linen (a big plus). The room was actually three times the size we were used to. We stayed in the rooms across from the main hotel in the courtyard and while the alley way can be a bit daunting and I don't think I'd chance it alone by myself late at night, it is well lit and very close to a door which leads directly to the hotel. As for the area, there are a lot of homeless people and yes a 25c peepshow but that's just the area. We never had any trouble or felt intimidated. There's a good nightlife on Granville St. and the hotel is also very close to the skytrain, only 10 min walk so the location was perfect. The hotel itself was clean, and staff were very friendly. The restaurant downstairs was a little pricey but nice. We only had a problem one night in particular as there was a group of around 25 college kids who acted up in the hallways and kept a lot of people up. It was annoying as I don't think staff did enough to stop them and left them stay again for a further two nights. Appart from this, for us it was great, we stayed for over a month: cheaper than a hostel and more secure plus the location suited us down to the ground. We were sad to leave once we found a house

Reviews.Title: “Very Clean, Great Restaurant, Excellent Staff”
Reviews.Author: Gr8Canadian
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in various properties for business trips within the Vancouver area, and rate this hotel as one of the best values. The rooms are exceptionally clean, and the staff are friendly and helpful. The restaurant decor and menu is fantastic, and once they complete their entire renovation it will be an even better hotel for business or pleasure

Reviews.Title: “Good Valu”
Reviews.Author: GDRODER
Reviews.Content: Room was extremely clean. Staff was quick and prompt. The hallways need to be updated, but are otherwise clean. Elevators need some TLC, but are otherwise safe and clean. The Elevators have no 13th floor. Got a good deal with a 30 day advanced booking. Would stay there again for same deal or slightly more money.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location, large clean rooms.”
Reviews.Author: side-tripper
Reviews.Content: My parents and I spent 4 nights in the 1 bedroom suit in the main tower. The room was clean and large, the decor slightly tired looking, had ample closet/cupboard and drawer space, 2 tvs, a fridge and microwave. No problems with the electronics/appliances/hot water. Can not comment on the wireless internet, as we did not use this feature. The sitting/living room had a couch that pulled out to a bed, (not too comfy to sleep on), a desk and 2 chairs. No complaints from my parents who slept on the beds in the bedroom. Our balcony opened up to a very large, landscaped terrace, but if you walked to the other end of it, you would also walk by all the other rooms that opened onto this space. IMO, a few chairs here would have been nice. Our view consisted of some high-rises, some other old/tired looking buildings that could use sprucing-up and the roof of the building next door, which had a noisy, buzzing generator of some kind. This buzzing noise wasn't noticable from inside the room. In fact, the room was fairly quiet, but every now and then, you could hear some of the loud, raucous party-goers that ventured off of Granville street and into the back ally, just below our room. The rate that we paid for the hotel included secure, underground parking and breakfast. (Deal found on internet). I was expecting a breakfast buffet, but we were given vouchers that entitled us to 2 scrambled eggs, toast, hashbrowns, orange juice and coffee. We're not big eaters, so the portion size more than filled us up. I also wouldn't hesitate to order from the menu, as it had a good variety of items at a reasonable price. In fact, this may be the better option if you are staying for an extended period of time and do not care to be eating the same thing every morning. The front desk staff did not acknowledge nor greet us any of the times that we walked through the lobby, but were friendly and helpful upon check-in/out and when approached with questions. The location of this hotel was good for our needs. Granville Island, B.C. Place, the Casino and Stanley Park were only a 5 minute drive or about a $10.00 cab ride away. Robson St. was 3 blocks away and it was an easy walk to Yale Town. We walked to Robson St. several times and passed by a vast array of places to grab a bite to eat. There were pizza/hamburger joints, convenience stores, trendy bars and elegant looking restaurants. There was also a Chinese restaurant at the corner of Granville and Davie that my brother-in-law recommended. We ate here one night and quite enjoyed it. There were a lot of different items to choose from on the menu at a price that wasn't "over the top". Service here was friendly and efficient. The Orpheum theater and Commodore Ballroom were just "up the street" and on a few occasions, we kidded my dad about checking out the 25 cent "peep show" that was just across the street from the hotel. Granville St. as well as Robson, were always abuzz with people from all walks of life. From the elegantly dressed, to the unfortunate homeless: and everything in between. On the Friday and Saturday evening, Granville street came alive with the late night party/club scene. Part of the street was closed to vehicles and had a number of police and other security present. I questioned this and was told that the increased security and lack of vehicles helped decrease the undesirable behaviour after the bars closed. We ventured out at different times of the day and night, (although not very late), with security present and without, but never did we feel threatened, nor unsafe. So, if you are the type of traveler or business-person, that is looking for a deal, that doesn't mind a room that could use some up-dating in the decor, or a few stains on the carpet this may be the place for you. If you insist on huge, fancy lobbies decked out in marble and expensive tile, surrounded by the likes of Louis Vuitton and Gucci, you might not be happy here.

Reviews.Title: “Rude Service, Scary Room”
Reviews.Author: jaclyn&jason
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Courtyard in the back of the Hotel. Our room was clean, and typical of a usual Best Western, however it was kind of errie that the windows had a metal mesh covering with frosted glass that you can't see out of, and they do not open - the room was VERY stuffy and hot when we arrived. the fire escape door (in the room) lead out to a covered stairwell - it was weird and echoed noises in the night. Upon arrival, the front desk staff did not say hello and we had to initiate the check-in process. they were kind of rude and didn't smile - almost like they really did not like their jobs. You also have to access the courtyard through a typical city back alley - but once inside it looked nice. I would stay somewhere else if I were you. This hotel was extremely overpriced for what you get. Oh, and room service was outrageosly priced. And parking IS NOT included in the room, even though you may be told that.

Reviews.Title: “I liked it”
Reviews.Author: ukkylie
Reviews.Content: Despite it's location, I liked this hotel. The staff were friendly upon check in and very informative. The room was clean, spacious and tidy. There are 3 in our party and we were supplied with 2 oversize double beds (in a separate bedroom) as well as a pull out couch. The shower was a bit dodgy (would either be scalding hot or freezing cold) but for the most part, I preferred staying there to my present location - the Fairmont Waterfront! I liked the balcony - as we had a few warm nights and could leave the door open. I would recommend this hotel to anyone who wanted value for money as well as a decent location in the downtown area.

Reviews.Title: “Skip it. . .”
Reviews.Author: KKK_K088
Reviews.Content: Staff is unprofessional. They dont even look at you when you walk in. Unprofessional and slow. The one girl didnt even know what she was doing. The rooms are average. Nothing spceial. There is lots of hotels downtown vancouver. stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “A FINE HOTEL FOR THE MONEY”
Reviews.Author: tobeginwith
Reviews.Content: Keep in mind this is a Best Western so it's definitely not super fancy. That said, me and my friend both enjoyed this hotel: great price, great location, above average room. What else do you need? We stayed at the Courtyard Hotel, which is behind the main tower across a somewhat sketchy alleyway. The setting is secure and private and it's more like staying at a studio apartment (I wish the room came with a fridge!). It's quiet, clean and spacious so all in all, I would recommend this place. When you book online you cannot tell where you will be staying (main tower vs courtyard room) so you might want to call the hotel ahead of time and see if that matters to you.

Reviews.Title: “skeptical”
Reviews.Author: antiquelover20
Reviews.Content: after reading other reviews I was skeptical but found this hotel to be wonderful. Our room was incredible- a suite and we were so pleased with the accomodations. We stayed on a Friday night and caught a cruise the next day, so we were very tired when we got to the hotel but found it to be very very good. Had breakfast the next morning in the restaurant and enjoyed it. The staff were very courteous and I would definately recommend this hotel to anyone...... thanks.....

Reviews.Title: “Really satisfactory stay for two days!”
Reviews.Author: miellove
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the courtyard room and liked an apartment setting. I liked the place with a good atmosphere like a real garden. Although one must walk across the back lane to the entrance of courtyard building, i didn't mind. The location is very convenient and new restaurant just opened, and looks like Granville street is a new street. I enjoyed the stay and also used local discount for some shopping. If I have a chance, I would like to stay there again. I had a really good time.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay for the money.”
Reviews.Author: seamo_11
Reviews.Content: The Chateau Granville was a very nice hotel for the money. As soon as I checked in, the clerk upgraded my room before I could even comment (Why? I'm not sure, but who's going to complain about a free upgrade.). The hotel staff was very helpful and friendly. They even advised us not to eat in the hotel restaurant, since there were much better places in the area (of course, he said not to mention that he said that). After reading many reviews on tripadvisor, we were nervous about the courtyard room we had chosen. But after checking in we were pleasantly surprised. The room was very spacious and clean. As well, the bed was the most comfortable bed we have seen in a hotel in this price range. The only complaint with the room was that it did not have a mini fridge, but we knew that prior to booking the room. We were lucky enought to get a second floor room at the end of the building on the front side, thus the room had four windows (including the bathroom window, which was the largest bathroom window we've ever seen in a hotel). The courtyard had a very comfortable atmosphere, similar to a townhouse neighborhood. As well, it was very well lit so there was no fear of walking back to the room at night, though the alley was not so well lit. But it was only about 30 meters from the secured parking garage to the courtyard gate, so it wasn't too much of a concern. We were glad that we chose the courtyard over the main building, since although we stayed in a hotel, it did not have that type of feeling to it. The hotel in general was very well situated, as we were able to walk nearly anywhere in the downtown area with ease. It was also well located for driving to farther sights. We would definitely recommend the courtyard rooms to anyone and would stay there again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “If negative stars could be awarded, this place would get them”
Reviews.Author: futurepm
Reviews.Content: I have absolutely nothing nice to say about the Best Western Chateau Granville. Everything about it was horrible, from the location to the uncomfortable beds. Among the lowlights: - if you stay in the Courtyard rooms, you need to walk through an extremely sketchy back alley; during the day, this means taking your life in your hands and dodging all the cars and trucks that use the alley as a delivery lane, while at night it means trying not to make eye contact with all the wandering drug addicts and homeless people who happen to be stumbling by. Of the four nights I stayed here, I ended up cabbing right to the Courtyard door two of them. - the location is awful; you may be right downtown, but you're on a street that's been under construction so long that half the businesses seem to be either relocated or closed entirely (NOTE: this doesn't apply to porn shops and peep shows, which populate this particular hotel's corner in abundance) - the above construction has extended from the street to the hotel itself, which meant that they couldn't offer any kind of room service - the rooms are small, cramped and dimly-lit, and have absolutely zero personality. Not only do the windows not allow any light in (they're frosted and have wires, just in case you were hoping for a nice institutional feel), they also don't open. - the wireless internet is most definitely not high-speed, unless you haven't been online in about fifteen years. Apart from the very last morning I was there, the max speed for my internet was about 2k/s, which made it virtually useless for anything other than reading e-mails (though getting it to actually open a log-in page was remarkably difficult). - The beds are small and cramped, even for just one person. They call them "queen-sized", but there's no way they're bigger than a double. - The cost: way higher than a hotel this lousy has any right to be. All in all, avoid this hotel. It's lacking in every way imaginable, and you should only stay here if you have absolutely no other options (and that includes staying at a YMCA).

Reviews.Title: “Not bad for the price”
Reviews.Author: just_droppin_by
Reviews.Content: I was in the courtyard, which is separated from the main hotel, had no proper window, but was appropriately priced. The road (Granville St) was undergoing construction, so I wasn't missing too much of a view. Service was OK.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expectation”
Reviews.Author: angela100Asia
Reviews.Content: We were very surprised when we checked into the Courtyard King room despite where the hotel was located. At first, we were not comfortable crossing the back alley to the Courtyard entrance. However, after awhile, we thought this was better than staying at the main building because of privacy of not going through the lobby each time. Courtyard room was very spacious and felt like home. Thought it was too spacious. It was too bad that there was no elevator in Courtyard but the space beside the Courtyard building gave a very peaceful feeling. Coming back from our side trip, we stayed at the large one bedroom suite facing the patio garden. It was very private and quiet. Despite where the hotel is located, it was only a short walking distance to Yaletown and the False Creek seawall. Also, the local discount being offered by the hotel was very useful, especially the yoga class in Yaletown. The underground parking space was tight between cars but after raising the concern to the hotel staff, we were told that the hotel was fully booked. Overall, staying at the hotel was a very good value for the money and we were pretty happy about the rooms, both in the Courtyard and the main building. We would definitely stay at the hotel in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and location..Not as bad as everyone says, trust me.”
Reviews.Author: mbergt
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in August 2008 for a concert. We did not rent a car, so this hotel was in an ideal location to explore Vancouver. At arrival, we were booked into a one-bedroom suite with a balcony overlooking downtown Vancouver- at no extra charge! The view at night was astonishing, and the noise was at a minimum. The room was very clean and had all of the amenities. Yes, Chateau Granville is located in the heart of downtown, and YES you may see a homeless person or two, or even some adult shops...But what do you expect? Go to Beverly Hills or somewhere else if being in a big city disturbs you. Vancouver is a diverse, lively, great city that has people of every kind. My boyfriend and I walked around at all hours of the night with no issues. I would recommend this hotel hands down for the average joe looking for a decent price and a fantastic jump-off point for exploring the city. Check out The Cambie Bar for a beer and some culture.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is a gem!”
Reviews.Author: ScouserSidney_B_C_
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed 31 nights at this hotel and found it perfect in every way. All staff went out of their way to do all in their power to make our stay pleasant at a very difficult time for us - my wife was having a kidney transplant at St. Paul`s hospital, just three blocks away. I can`t thank front-desk staff, concierge, restaurant and cleaning personnel enough for their kindnesses and warmth. Also, the room rate we received was carefully tailored to our resources. We are both VERY impressed with everything about the Chateau Granville.

Reviews.Title: “Great place if you want your car broken in”
Reviews.Author: brooklynviews
Reviews.Content: The room was clean and the staff helpful. However, I paid to park my car in the secured parking lot and within 2 hours of my arrival my front passenger window was smashed. Nothing was stolen. But then it got broken into again later that night. They stole a GPS from a nearby car. Turns out the P2 level has no cameras or security. The comped me for parking, but it took a week to get the glass for my car.... Bruce made the situation better by being quite helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Good value suite”
Reviews.Author: kingswoodflyer
Reviews.Content: Had an enjoyable stay here in a 1 bed suite which was great value for the price I paid. While the hotel is a bit beat up around the edges, the suite I was given on the 10th floor was more that adequate for my needs and the inclusion of fridge, microwave and coffee maker was appreciated. Bed was just about OK, being slightly softer than I would have liked but bearable for the 5 nights I was there. As I was on the side of the building not facing Granville Street I wasnt affected by noise and sound insulation between rooms was also good. I enjoyed the location and while there is a sex shop across the road and some homeless people asking for change, I never once felt threatened and the atmosphere in a couple of the bars I visited along Granville St was amiable. Walking to the Pacific Mall took me about 10-15 minutes and about 25 minutes to Canada place at a steady pace. Many fast food places, restaurants and convenience stores in the area. Staff at the hotel were friendly in my dealings with them and I would definitely stay here again for business or leisure.

Reviews.Title: “This was totally brutal”
Reviews.Author: mfallis
Reviews.Content: So, if you like to catch some zzz's in a hotel and get a good nights rest, do not stay here. "Chateau" Granville is extremely misleading. From the drug addicts at the side of the building to the porn shop across the street this is not a nice area to stay. The staff was not friendly or helpful in giving directions. I don't know how the building is standing because it has the thinnest walls. We could here the neighbouring guests come home at 3:45am. And the noise from the street lasted all night. Including the screams as if someone was being attacked. It was old and looks terrible from the outside. If we hadn't prepaid, I would have 100% moved to another hotel. I was really disappointed as Best Western is a name that you should be able to trust. Don't recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money”
Reviews.Author: RuiJorge
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel as part of our 2 weeks holiday in the area. Had the court yard room location. All was very good and the location too. Highly recommended in terms of value for money.

Reviews.Title: “appearences are good but not for all”
Reviews.Author: albodo11
Reviews.Content: the rooms were ok but the all night parting down granville street kept us up scince we could hear it in to the wee hours of the night. we used the glasses the first night and I found reminence of my lipgloss from the night before on the "cleaned "glasses with the new paper lids indicating they had been cleaned some clearks at the desk were outright rude or indifferent at one point refusing totell a diebetic patron if there was a refigerator in the room to store her medication!!! the rooms were roomy but serivce was not good and for the price it should be I will not stay there again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: luvtotravelyo
Reviews.Content: This was a great, cheap hotel. The staff was friendly and helpful, and the rooms were clean. We stayed in one of the Courtyard rooms because they were cheaper ($79 for a double), and like other people have said, you access it from the back alley. But this was perfectly fine and not "dodgy" at all. People have said that this is a bad neighbourhood, with street people, porn shops, etc. All of this is true, but I lived in Vancouver for four years, and would not ever say that this is a bad neighbourhood and have never felt threatened. This is a very central location, just a short walk to Yaletown and Robson Street. With the Howard Johnson up the street and the Ramada Inn just down the street, you can't go with this inexpensive option.

Reviews.Title: “Good Downtown Vancouver Location”
Reviews.Author: TorontoDavid12
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel in January for a business trip. While I was a little concerned regarding the hotel based on other online reviews, I found that the stay was uneventful. The rooms were clean, the service friendly, and the location great. It is located on popular Granville street, a short walk from Yale Town which worked very well for my meetings. One has to expect that when you are staying in the heart of the city - and the entertainment district that the calibre of street life outside the front door is not the same as a suburban neighbourhood. However, the people on the street were friendly, and no-one bothered me at all. The rest of the downtown hotels that I looked at (Comfort Inn, Ramada, Hojo, Holiday Inn) are all located in the same area and have the same issues. However, the BW is a full service hotel offering a second floor restaurant with a pleasant view, high speed internet, and free passes to Fitness World across the street (which I really enjoyed - it had a much better facility than any hotel gym I have experienced. All in all, I enjoyed my stay, and will stay here again on my next trip to Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Way better than expected”
Reviews.Author: dnt105
Reviews.Content: Read the reveiws here and on another travel site. It seemed like the only compaint that permeated the majority of the reviews I read was the location- across from a couple of adult book stores. Well, that's true, but you know that going in. Also- you are staying on Granville Street, lots of bars, clubs, etc, so some "bad elements" are to be expected. We stayed in the towers, a room on the top floor with a balcony view overlooking Granville Street. We could also see the mountains in the distance (when it wasn't so cloudy). The staff at the hotel was great, very helpful. They even had a concierge/guest services rep on duty to help you with anything from finding a store to picking a restaurant to booking a tour. I never expected THAT from a Best Western. The lobby was fine, rooms were very clean, decor was hotel-typical. If we decide to stay on Granville our next visit, we would definitely stay at the Chateau Granville.

Reviews.Title: “Dont stay here-please”
Reviews.Author: thrustvector
Reviews.Content: I dont normally feel compelled to write reviews, but felt I needed to warn people about this hotel. 1) incorrect room allocation double instead of twin, which took one hell of a row to change. 2) Very dodgy "courtyard" room accessed through an even more dodgy back alley. 3) 1 of the worst heighbourhoods I have ever passed through. Its the 1st time in my life I have just walked out of a hotel after paying, it really was that bad. Do yourself a big big favour stay elsewhere you'll be grateful you did

Reviews.Title: “Don't Stay There”
Reviews.Author: ghorse
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for work because of free access to fitness world. Hotel was noisy, dingy and in a terrible neighbourhood. Little or no sleep due to street noise. Staff was rude and unhelpful. I travel a lot for work and will not be staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Totally Unacceptable”
Reviews.Author: cxg
Reviews.Content: Rooms booked through hotels.com had windows painted over. YOU COULD NOT SEE OUT! Staff refused to move us to another room because of booking through hotels.com. Had to carry luggage up stairs after going through a dirty back alley to access room. Rooms extremely small and bed was like sleeping on cardboard. Very basic amenities. Room also had ledge in it with an escape door on top of ledge (wierd) lots of noise outside of escape door. Sounded like they received deliveries outside of door. Ice machine not working. Staff provided wrong telephone numbers to rental car companies. ALL THAT AND WE ONLY STAYED 1 NIGHT. It was bad!

Reviews.Title: “not so bad after all...”
Reviews.Author: kwenga
Reviews.Content: For our last night in Vancouver we booked this one by phoning from the tourist information office in Mission. Some other hotels I still remembered from TA were already booked, so I went for this one without knowing too much about it. English is not my first language, but it definitely was the same for the lady I spoke with on the phone, which made conversation a bit difficult at times. Front desk was not overwhelmingly friendly but ok, bellman was very nice, though. We were lucky to end up on the 15th floor, the noise wasn't too bad up there. The room and the bath were quite nice and very clean, the bed comfy and the aircon not too noisy. As about people complaining about the area, I didn't find that to be too intimidating (I also did not hear any noise from people shouting on the streets etc.). There are homeless people nearly everywhere in the inner city. It was ok for a night, but I probably would not stay there again if I could find something nicer for the same price (which you probably can)

Reviews.Title: “Good choice”
Reviews.Author: Laurie3501
Reviews.Content: Due to a forest fire evacuation in Washington State, we took a rather unexpected two-day vacation to Vancouver. We didn't have time to do as detailed a web search as we normally would do for a vacation, so we were quite pleased with our experience here. This hotel is downtown Vancouver--which is what we were looking for. We wanted the ability to walk the downtown area without having to jump in our car. There is a very tiny parking area where you can park while you check in, but we ended up parking in the street since the parking space was already occupied by a vehicle. Check-in was prompt and courteous. We were in a one-bedroom suite on the 12th floor. The suite was huge! The main bedroom had a king-sized bed, dresser, chair, TV armoire, and two closets. The bathroom was large and contained a hair dryer and all the typical toiletry products. We were shy one set of towels in the bathroom--and they were brought up within five minutes after a call to the front desk. The living area was also huge. There was a nice office space, where we were able to use our laptop through the hotel's free wireless connection. Across from that area was nice large built-in, which housed a large television, a mini-frig, microwave, and coffee and supplies. Also in the living area was a large pull-out sofa, which our daughter slept on. A couple of tables and chair completed the area. Sliding glass doors led out onto a fairly large balcony/deck, with great views of downtown Vancouver. Our bill came to just over $400 for two nights, which included parking in their enclosed parking garage. (The parking was $12 plus tax per night, with daily in & out privledges.) There appeared to be plenty of parking, but the spaces are a bit tight. The hotel faces a couple 24-hour XXX book stores--so I'm not sure if I'd be completely comfortable walking there late at night. During the daytime, however, there really were no problems (just some interesting characters!). The hotel is one street away from many of the more upscale hotels, and just a few blocks from great shopping and dining on Robson street. Perhaps it's because we were way up on the 12th floor, but it wasn't noisy, even though the hotel's on a busy street. We were told that the hotel was built with a lot of concrete--so the floors and walls are solid and extremely quiet . . . no annoying toilet flushing noises from the floor above! We heard absolutely no noise from other hotel guests, which was amazing. There appears to be a lot of construction downtown right now, no doubt in preparation for the 2010 Olympic Games in Vancouver. I would imagine that this area of downtown could be getting a mini-makeover before then. Overall, we had a very positive experience at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Walked Out As Soon As We Checked In”
Reviews.Author: ChatoGranvleStinks
Reviews.Content: When I booked my stay at the Chateau Granville on the internet, it looked as if it met my expectations of a nice hotel. As I arrived, there were 5 adult bookstores and shops within 500 feet, many homeless persons wandering the streets, and a good amount of street thugs. The front desk was empty, and we waited a good five minutes for any service. The hallways were dark, and the "newly remodeled" rooms were a dump. The view from the room was horrible. You could see all of the adult shops and people on the streeet. We immediately opened the phonebook to look for another hotel, and did not stay the night. Instead we stayed at the Hyatt Hotel in Vancouver, which was fabulous. Their newly remodeled rooms had great views of the city, luxurious beds, flat screen televisions, and high class furniture. Save your troubles and stay at the Hyatt. Do not stay at the Chateau Granville.

Reviews.Title: “10 sstory bunker”
Reviews.Author: mupawa
Reviews.Content: Service was terrible. Bellman was surly, counter staff clueless. Our phone didnt work, our free internet didn't work. Neighbourhood was noisy. Hotel was run down and dated. Neighbourhood dangerous - we learned the morning of our check out that there was a double homicide the night before around the corner from the hotel. When I wrote them about all this they offered me a $25 gift certificate - the total room bill with breakfast was $250. Would not go here if I were you.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: OUMOM
Reviews.Content: We stayed three nights at this hotel. It is in the heart of downtown Vancouver withing walking distance to restaurants. The hotel itself is clean and very nice, the location of the hotel is horrible as far as being located right by bars and clubs that stay open to all hours of the night. Our first night was horrible because we heard all the noise from the streets, drunks yelling and cussing at each other until way into the early morning hours, therefore no sleep all night. Asked that night for another room but of course didn't have one. Next morning early asked to be put on the 15th floor, were on the 3rd floor night before. They accommodated us and we had the top floor for the next two nights. Noise still there, but not quite as bad and on other side of hotel. Would not recommend any hotel in the downtown area due to street noise and bars. The hop on and off tour worth the money to see Vancouver. Went to Victoria for two days and enjoyed it even more, but still don't recommend downtown hotels in Victoria either, bad experience for us all around with hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Welcome to the skids”
Reviews.Author: lenny67
Reviews.Content: Stayed on the 11th floor noise all night til 4am very little sleep, all we heard was yelling and screaming throughout the night. Frontend staff are terriable, when I asked about parking availability , when I made a reservation the clerk said it was available but forgot to mention it was $12 a day when I commented about parking the clerk snapped "Well you are in Vancouver ya know". When you do park in the underground the checkin clerk tells you to "READ THE SIGNS as we are not responsible for the parking area". Signs say remove all articles from car. You see why when you pull up to the undergroud, street people passed out in the alley and millling about. Your view is out onto the street looking down at peepshow storefronts and pornshops. While on the street people asking if you want to buy dope. I would not recommend a family stay unless you want your kids to have an eyeopener.
