Look elsewhere Rooms where decent but if you can't sleep, no much use.

Reviews.Title: “No Food, Comfort or Ease of Mind”
Reviews.Author: tc3670_only
Reviews.Content: I arrived for the first of two nights but left ASAP, willingly forfeiting paid dues. Lobby, initial check-in person, and room had decent mid-range qualities. Room seemed clean and quiet. Free in-room wireless internet worked well; just had to login on Telus interface every session. On the other hand, there was running heat but it was not effective. Dark hallway felt desolate and unsafe. Hotel restaurant/lounge was worse than if one never existed. It looked dead even at dinner hour, and there was a closure sign in front of one section. A polite enquiry with on-duty front desk was met with apparent deceit. Location was a bit scary. There is youth drop-in centre within one block off of Granville Street, at least partly accounting for many groups of men or youths loitering on nearby streets. There were also quite a few homeless persons (more than elsewhere), and they can be quite forward. There were also sleazy tattoo parlours and porn shops on this stretch of Granville. Cost benefit tradeoffs were not worthwhile - especially for females, families or single travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Barebones, friendly but not efficient service”
Reviews.Author: drunkenfilosofer
Reviews.Content: For the price I paid, about USD 70, I would have expected a nicer lobby and a more pleasantly decorated room. It looked a little run-down. The central location in downtown, two blocks from the public library was quite convenient, though.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Expect Too Much”
Reviews.Author: Jupiter79
Reviews.Content: The location isn't wonderful, but it's close enough to walk around the heart of Vancouver. Being a major city, I wouldn't fault the hotel for noise and homeless people asking for change. However, the staff was robotic. The bellman even sighed and huffed when asked to store our bags for a couple hours. At check-in, there wasn't a smile to be seen on any of the faces who work there. After check-in, we realized we were booked into the wrong room type. Still, we didn't say anything. Honestly, I can only imagine the reception we would have received. This is the same reason I cleaned the bathtub myself after finding quite a bit of hair. Needless to say, I won't stay there again. However, if you're a college student or on a tight budget, this should be right up your alley.

Reviews.Title: “Bad area - don't stay there”
Reviews.Author: Buzzto
Reviews.Content: While Vancouver is absolutely wonderful, this hotel is located in a bad area of downtown. I was on the top floor (15th) and it was extremely noisy outside all night. Many other clients complained about the noise level too. Nice and clean hotel though but I will not go back there.

Reviews.Title: “very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Was a little wary of this hotel because of some of the reviews I had read. But was very surprised how nice it actually was. Had a king size room on the 14th floor, was very clean and comfortable. Noise was not a problem never heard anybody in the next room. Wasn't expecting a bellman but we had one take our bags up, that was nice for a change. Neighborhood is not great but we enjoyed walking around the night we were there. Lots of interesting people to see. We would definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “beware of the Courtyard”
Reviews.Author: pilgrim-tabibito
Reviews.Content: I'd give this hotel a lower rating but the price was great for downtown Vancouver. We stayed in the Courtyard section of the hotel. The room was clean and nice except for a bathroom door that wouldn't close. This would be a fairly nice hotel if it wasn't in a bad area of town. To access the Courtyard one had to cross an alley that was frequented by prostitutes and homeless people. It's okay by day but I'd be concerned at night and was a little worried when my wife was by herself. Personally next time, I'd spend a little more to be in a nicer area of town. The strip clubs, peep shows, prostitutes, etc wasn't worth the extra money saved.

Reviews.Title: “Good deal”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed there for six days in early December 2005. The hotel is in a not so nice part of town, but it is an excellent deal and one can easily walk everywhere. The suites are nice spacious and clean and the service is very good. Room service is fast, food is Ok and very reasonably priced. The only thing I did not like - the windows are single glazed - very low, can easily open FULLY and have NO screens so I would definitely not recommend it to anyone with small children. It is very dangerous especially on higher floors. I am surprised the management did not do something about this. But apart from that, it is a good comfortable hotel for someone who needs a base to explore Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Lousy hotel. Don't stay here!”
Reviews.Author: SridharCanada
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a seedy part of town. It is unsafe to walk outside after dusk. You run into panhandlers the minute you step outside. Rooms are neat and well maintained but VERY NOISY. You can hear loud music and yelling at 3 in the morning. Front desk staff are rude. They gave incorrect info on both occasions I asked them. Place to avoid !

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a funky part of town”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I agree with the previous reviews. The hotel is great. We stayed in the high rise. The room was absolutely enormous. It was a suite with a seperate bedroom (two queens) and living room (couch and chair). It had all the amenities including a microwave and refrigerator. Although I didn't use it, it also has free high speed internet. The room is very clean. The shower is strong, soothing, and very clean. For the price ($102), it was a great deal. However, if you are freaked out by porn, punks, and pizza shops, then this isn't the hotel for you. The stretch of Granville Street that the hotel is located on is very alternative. Lots of porn shops, peep shows, piercing and tattoo shops, goth-looking nightclubs. We could hear people yelling outside our window when the bars closed. One of the highlights is the hair salon without a front window or door with bikini clad hair stylists cutting hair. Of course, the stylists are tattooed and pierced in various places. Fun to see but you wouldn't want to take them home to momma. This stretch also has more pizza places per square mile than anyplace on the planet. I recommend going directly across to the street from the hotel to the corner store advertising 93 cent pizza slices. They are huge and yummy. My sister and I walked this street and didn't encounter any problems. Of course, it's a big city with lots of funky looking people, 99.9% of which just want to be left alone. It also has very normal looking people. Looming over the hotel, there are many very expensive high rise condomineums. Don't be afraid to book this hotel but remember to pack your sense of adventure.

Reviews.Title: “Find another hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: If you like a rough, alternative neighborhood full of night clubs, porno shops, liquor stores and hordes of homeless people, then the Best Western Chateau Granville is your place. We stayed in the courtyard behind the hotel which was offering a cheaper rate than the rooms inside the tall high rise hotel. The courtyard itself was nice but I would advise people to stay in the hotel instead because in order to get to the courtyard, you have to walk through a dark alley where many homeless people are trolling for tourists ready to ask you for money, weed or liquor. The alley is a bit sketchy even during the daytime hours; you just never know who is lurking in the alley waiting for you to pull out your keycard so they can mug you. Also, there are no wheelchair ramps or elevators so if you have a lot of heavy luggage, you'll be hauling it up the steps. The rooms were nice but small which is okay; the only bad part about the room was that the walls were very thin and you could hear people coming and going and walking above you as you tried to sleep. I suggest you stay somewhere in Yaletown where it's a lot trendier, safer, full of great restaurants and you'll be closer to the water.

Reviews.Title: “Best Kept secret in Downtown Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: Patissier1
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Best Western Chateau Granville in May 2005. It might be the best kept secret in Downtown Vancouver . If you are looking for a great hotel value, centrally located in a safe area, with clean and comfortable rooms, an a outstanding staff, The chateau granville is it. If you are looking for a Ritz carlton type hotel, the Best Western Chateau Granville it is not for you. I will definitely stay there again.

HotelInfo.Name: BEST WESTERN PLUS Chateau Granville
HotelInfo.Address: 1100 Granville Street, Vancouver, British Columbia V6Z 2B6, Canada
